Job Title: Senior Mechanical Design and Controls Integration Engineer

Location: Indianapolis, IN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Other

Description:
Senior Mechanical Design and Controls Integration EngineerPosition Overview:Join E-Solutions as a dynamic and driven programmer, where you'll spearhead mechanical design and controls integration initiatives. We're on the lookout for a talented individual to collaborate with our team, engineers, and stakeholders, shaping advanced mechanical systems melded with cutting-edge control solutions for the nuclear medicine sector.Client Benefits:Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with Match - Paid Time Off - Paid HolidaysDuties/Responsibilities:Design and innovate mechanical systems infused with advanced control mechanisms.Craft meticulous control designs for diverse products, from conceptualization to prototyping, based on detailed mechanical and electrical blueprints.Develop controls schematics and wiring diagrams utilizing MS Visio.Engage in design evaluations, offering insights to enhance functionality, efficiency, and safety.Foster collaboration across teams to ensure project alignment with cost, quality, and time parameters.Maintain and enhance design documentation, encompassing technical specs, assembly guidelines, and user manuals.Execute controls component development and integration, leveraging Computer-Aided-Design principles.Apply expertise in building controls systems.Assist in all facets of building controls, including engineering control drawings, configuration, programming, commissioning, and troubleshooting.Prior experience with Honeywell, KMC control devices, and Niagara software advantageous.Adhere to company engineering and software standards for all construction projects.Proficiently manage project schedules, costs, and contractual obligations.Represent E-Solutions with professionalism and responsiveness to clients.Provide project programming and system validation as needed.Qualifications:Exceptional communication skillsProficiency in technical writing and verbal communicationStrong analytical and problem-solving aptitudeAbility to discern customer requirements and develop project scopesCapability to interpret and implement specifications from mechanical and electrical drawingsExperience with building automation systemsProven ability to collaborate effectively across teamsProficient in MS Office (especially Outlook, Word, Excel) and MS VisioTwo or four-year degree or equivalent experience with a focus on electrical components, computers, networks, and control systems, particularly direct digital control systems.
5% travel requirement.
Preferred:Bachelor’s degree in electrical, mechanical engineering, mechanical engineering technology, or related fieldOver 5 years of relevant work experienceExperience with Honeywell or KMC controlsBackground in the Nuclear Medicine industryLicense/Certifications/Education:OSHA 10/30 certificationTridium N4 Certification or equivalent expertise

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
